intro: Tithymalus koilopremnos, commonly known as the narrow-leaved tithymalus, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, upright stems and finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pale yellow, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. Native to regions of southern Europe and western Asia, it thrives in sunny, well-drained soils. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and traditional herbal practices.
